comment: Overall, I have enjoyed this class to an extent. The professor is an extremely tough grader, but if you meet with her, you will see that she does take the time to hear your concerns and she is sweet when you talk with her with respect. However if you are looking for an easy A, do NOT take this prof. Rubrics are vague and your grade can be confusing

Dr. Ethel King-McKenzie provides tough love, but it's clear that she truly cares about her students. She pushes us to grow as future educators and doesn't sugarcoat the realities of teaching, which makes her guidance even more valuable. Her honesty, experience, and support make her one of the most impactful professors I've had.

Dr. Ethel King-McKenzie genuinely cares about her students. Before each class, she invites us to share our field experiences and offers practical advice on how to approach various situations in the classroom. She responds to emails promptly and provides many opportunities for extra credit!

Dr.King-Mckenzie is a professor who truly cares about her students. She offers alot of extra credit to help with your grade. She is a easy grader and allows you to redo something so you can get a berter grade. I do not understand the hate she gets because she is so sweet. Only thing you need to do is talk in your "teachers voice".

DO NOT TAKE THIS WOMAN. DO NOT DO IT. JOIN A WAITLIST. TAKE A CLASS OVER THE SUMMER. DO NOT TAKE HER. Not only is she extremely rude, disrespectful, and condescending, she doesn't even know her own syllabus, instructions for assignments, or due dates. I have seen her make students cry, get physical with a student, and cause so much suffering.

She's literally the worst. She will sometimes answer emails but when she does she is very condescending. She literally made someone cry FIRST DAY OF CLASS. If you can avoid this professor do it.. I'm telling you do not take her and if you end up getting her... good luck.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Just a really awful professor to deal with. She's strict with by the book ways, and stuck in her own mindset. She will change your grade for no reason. She definitely narrows down on students she doesn't like, and makes the semester horrible for them. If this is the only professor for the course, PLEASE just don't bother. Save yourself.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: I value a stern yet supportive strategy personally. However, I don't cherish this class one bit. She does not grade based off her own rubrics. Either straight zeros or 100% but she's extremely picky. Her feedbacks are biased and unclear. This class is hard but not impossible. You just got to endure and fight your way to pass. Just disappointed.
This professor is awful! She is rude and hateful with her feedback and emails. She is not helpful with her feedback and will give you a zero with no explanation. She does not need to be teaching!

She was the only professor available to register and IT MAKES SENSE. Extremely picky and always call people out to embarrass them (in order to grow she saids). There are moments where even she doesn't know what she's doing but we get a bad grade for it. Very strict and not sympathetic even during tough times as she claims she was. AVOID HER!

This was by far the worst Professor that I have ever had in all my years of education!! She will call out students in class and shame you for answering incorrectly. She is very picky on assignments and will take off a lot of points for small details. Avoid her.

This professor is very difficult to work with. She will embarrass and call out students in front of the entire class. She is also extremely rude in emails and with the feedback that she gives. She looks down on students and will not treat you as a future professional. Please, if you can, avoid her and take another professor.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Do not take a course from this professor. The rubrics and course requirements do not match the grading criteria. She will not provide you with any helpful feedback toward improvement. You will spend more time second-guessing if you want to finish college than you will ever learn in this class. KSU should intervene and not sure why they have not.

If you can take any class that this professor teaches from another college or professor, it is recommended. I have never rated any professor on this platform, but I feel compelled to warn others against the unprofessionalism and stress that you will endure. It's unbelievable that this is acceptable in education.

Dr. Ethel- King, was the most unprofessional professor I have had. She made me feel very uncomfortable in class. Took most of the class lecturing, gave very rude comments and feedback. Her policy on assignments were outrages. Please take another professor for this course, will save you from your grade and emotional well being.

I highly recommend Dr.King-McKenzie for her caring approach, exceptional preparation, and insightful teaching. Her class encourages critical thinking and challenges preconceptions. It's disheartening to see unfair reviews; she truly stands out as an educator.

I can not stress enough to not take this professor. Please, spare yourself. She is the worst teacher I have ever had, she is almost impossible to work with. Do not be fooled by the initial easy grading of the discussion boards, when it comes to important assignments, she is IMPOSSIBLE even if you follow the rubric. this class is a GPA assassin.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: if you by some chance get this professor, drop add immediately. do not put your mental health in jeopardy by taking this professor. She is horrible at her job, super difficult to get a hold of, and refuses to accept if she is wrong. She talks to students like they are below her, and assumes they are wrong ALWAYS and will not try to help.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! This professor is extremely confusing and does not adhere to her rubrics. She makes this class merely impossible! I usually give all professors the benefit of the doubt and choose them despite their ratings, though this was the worst mistake I could've made. SAVE YOURSELF AND YOUR GPA !

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. I promise that she is not better than the reviews make her sound. I am taking her in-person "hybrid" class... I have never struggled in school and this class was unnecessarily difficult. The projects are impossible to get a good grade on, even if you follow the rubric. horrible at responding to emails and is super rude.

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR! Take this class online instead; It will be the best decision of your life. This is considered a Hybrid class, but be prepared to learn absolutely nothing for the one day of the week you are there. The projects that she gives are confusing, and even if you do everything on the rubric, she will still give you a bad grade.

Passing the class is not hard if you do your work. However, she is rude when you ask questions or for help. And when you return the tone she calls you disrespectful. I don't feel like I got anything out of this class. Just went through the assignments to pass and get it over with.

These negative reviews of Dr. Ethel are not fair. Note there is a cultural difference as she's not from the States. People call her rude when in reality she is just blunt. She holds us to a high standard. If you're a future educator, appreciate it. She did LOTS to reduce stress and improve our grades. Give her a chance and she will return the favor

She was a tough grader which is fine except she never gave any feedback on what you needed to fix, this was online and she was difficult to get into contact with. She would not help when I asked what I needed to work on because I was told my grade was low and she told me to figure it out myself. I would not recommend her if you can help it.

This professor is kind and does what she can to ensure students succeed in the course. This course is educational and not difficult if you make sure to follow the instructions exactly as written. If anything is unclear I would recommend communicating this to the professor.

Very aggressive all of them time towards students, also very snarky comments when students email to ask for help. Would give zeros on project assignments for the smallest things such as submitting it in a different format that was given, even if your laptop does not download assignments the way they want you to.

She will work with you! She wants her students to pass her class with an A (as she says a lot). While she is a tough grader, often passive aggressive, and does not provide helpful feedback, if you do exactly what she asks on her assignments, you are almost guaranteed an A. Just show up, participate, and work hard!

Professor King-McKenzie is a very frustrating professor. Although she will allow for resubmissions by her discretion, which is much appreciated, she will give a zero for an entire assignment and ask you fix a resubmit based solely on wording. She has made me resubmit in fear of keeping a zero because she wanted me to change a word's tense only.

She is a hard professor that no one sees eye to eye with. She is a pretty easy grader but doesn't explain if you get points off. You have to do all the work but if you bs it you can still get good grades. You'll need to talk to classmates about the assignments to understand, but try to take a different professor!!

BEWARE! DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE! Unless you want a semester full of assignments with missing deadlines, along with a tedious schedule, don't forget the no communication this isn't for you. Directions for assignments are unclear unless you submit exactly what she wants. If you forget to attach a rubric even though it is not said, you will get a 0.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS!!! She is very hard to please when it comes to projects. If it's not exactly like hers then you get an F. Doesn't give good feedback at all. Only sends a sample (that doesn't even match the instructions) after you have submitted the assignment. Her instructions and Course outline are very confusing. Stay away from her class!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: DO NOT TAKE HER! She is difficult to please, assignments are unclear. I DREAD her class. harsh feedback She is confusing and I never know what to expect. We have daily logs on methodologies, expected to write a few paragraphs for each but don't tell us what they are. Pointless assignments. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS!
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I love Dr. King-McKenzie. She is tough but honest. Work hard and see her during office hours, for sure!

Never take this teacher unless it is your only option. This class is doable, but will randomly be picky about grading your project. Multiple class members and I had to talk to the dean. I can't express how bad of a teacher she is in this short bubble. Just stay clear from her at all costs.

If I could give this professor a zero, I would. She is extremely rude and passive aggressive. You cannot turn in pdf documents, which is what most professors want, and if you turn in anything other than a word doc (which not everyone has or can pay for), she will not grade it and not care.

Dr. Mckenzie is incredibly passive-aggressive and discourages you from asking questions. When you do email her a question, she responds in a way that is snippy, rude, and condescending. Do not take her!!! She also withholds project grades based on minor details but doesn't clarify for what. I would give her a zero if i could

Dr. King-McKenzie watches out for those who are humble and respectful. She is from a different culture so you may need to observe from afar before approaching her like you would any professor. I personally enjoyed reading the text book required for class and learning in her classroom. I found her to be charismatic.

Dr. King-McKenzie is an awful professor. She makes you feel stupid and embarrass you infront of the whole class. She will post your grade for your assignment under your discussion post for the whole class to see. Her communication skills are very poor. When she grades your papers they arent clear. Youll have to fight for your grade muliple times.

She comes off as very kind, if you are struggling and talk to her she will help you. But she is so rude and makes it very hard to participate in class. She will embarrass you in front of the class if you disagree with her. She has a specific way of grading that she doesn't discuss with the class. Don't take her if it's possible

I read previous reviews and I thought I could handle it, but she is by far the WORST professor I have ever taken. She literally told us to observe children but not tell their parents. She'll ask your opinion and if they aren't hers, you're wrong. She doesn't make hardly any sense at all and her material is ridiculous and specific. DO NOT take her!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: This professor was very unclear with her grading. Even though it is not an English class it is treaded like one. Your grammar needs to be on point or she will destroy your grade. I felt as if the good work I did was still graded very low. She is very condescending to her students. I felt like I learned nothing useful for my major. AVOID HER!!!!

Dr. King-Mackenzie is a wonderful professor! She gets to know her students on a personal level and really shows she cares. She makes everyone feel welcomed. If you are not paying attention, she will call you out, but she means well. She just expects us to treat her with respect. I would take her for every class if I could. She is hilarious!

This professor communication skills need a lot of work. She rarely listens to students and does not seem to care if they struggle. I tried so hard in this class and it rarely seemed to matter. She often seems disorganized and unnecessary lesson plans. Slow response time to emails. I would not recommend her.

This professor was the worst I've taken at KSU. She's very rude and her class is unnecessarily difficult. You can turn in quality A work that you've worked very hard on and only get a C (this happened to several students on many assignments). If you are student teaching while taking 4403, save yourself the added stress and DON'T take her.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This professor is absolutely terrible. She doesn't know what she is talking about and gets off topic super easily. She doesn't write her own syllabus, just borrows from another prof and puts her name on it. She is condescending and rude, and unprepared to teach. DO NOT TAKE IF YOU ARE MID/SEC ED!!! She only cares about elementary. DON'T TAKE!!!!!!

This was the most inconsistent professor I've encountered. Grading system is arbitrary and does not coincide with the provided rubrics. She has a very specific idea of how she wants papers/assignments to be written - anything other than her expectation will result in a low grade. Her feedback is harsh, so prepare your thick skin! Avoid if possible.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: BEWARE. She is by far the worst teacher I've had at KSU. She gives NO positive feedback & will make you feel extremely stupid. Things are her way & that is all. The only good thing was that we all had each other throughout the semester to help each other out bc she will not help you, also is not clear on what she usually wants from you. Goodluck
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. King-Mckenzie is a fantastic instructor. She expects a lot, so don't be surprised if she grades sternly. In later days you will be glad that she pushed you.

Not a professor that needs to be teaching an online class. I'm offended by the comments that state we don't like her class because we are children. On the contrary, I feel like more of a professional than she is. There is zero communication. Rubrics are vague and her grading system is completely unreasonable.

King-McKenzie gives very specific instructions in class but when grading, she changes expectations. There are options to redo assignments but that delays grading very significantly and oftentimes the feedback is so vague, it is difficult to make the changes. When writing lesson plans, it seems she is not clear on what the standards are.

So we can tell who failed this class by the comment. It baffles me when my classmates don't participate in their education but think they deserve As b/c they came to class. She is fair as the day is long. She seems intimidating, but I think that is her culture, she isn't from here. She is not trying to teach you SS she is teaching how to teach it.

STAY AWAY! This class was by far the worst class I have ever taken during my 4 years at college. The workload is insane, and I do not actually think I learned anything . Her grading is horrendous, and you get no specific feedback-just question marks all over your paper. No social skills and very rude! Avoid at all costs!

Prepare yourself for a horrible semester! If you have the option to go with a different professor, do so. The work load was insane, instructions were not clear, your grades will not be determined till the last day, and don't even bother asking for help. Literally I'd rather take calculas on a Saturday then suffer through this class one more time.

As a TOSS professor, Ethel King-Mckenzie does not teach her TOSS students how to teach social studies. This class is meant to teach future teachers how they can go out, and effectively teach a social studies class - it did not happen. If you want to learn how to teach a social studies class, then seek out another professor.

RUN- Run fast and run far. If you have to take classes on the moon at 3am every Friday and Saturday to avoid this professor- DO IT!! She is unprofessional, unresponsive, and unfair. Expect giant projects with little guidance and don't you dare ask her for help or clarification- she'll let you know right where to go. You've been warned.
I have taken her twice for classes. She is awesome! I would recommend her to anyone if you're really serious about becoming a good teacher. Love her and the class. Excellent asset.

Dr. Ethel is an excellent professor. She is very professional and has the same expectations of you. I'm not sure what people mean when they say she doesn't answer her emails; she is very prompt to answer emails. If you email during a holiday you may have to wait a day but she responds. She allows you to come to her office. Very fair. Loved class.
Very direct and informative.  We are expected to keep up with the curriculum like adults.
Very direct and informative.

This was probably one of the worst classes I've taken thus far.  Not involved in the class at all.  Would take at least a week to return an e-mail, if at all.  Condescending to her students.  The group projects are absurd for 1) an online course and 2) for building your lesson plansclassroom procedures.  We're all different specialties.

This professor does not need to be teaching online classes. I don't know if she is any better in person but her online class was horrible. The grading criteria was unclear, the syllabus was unclear, communication was pretty much zero. When she did bother to answer correspondence, she was antagonizing and rude.

Do not take her if you enjoy organization, clear instructions for assignments, or questions to be answered in a timely manner.  It took her four days to finally get back to me through e-mail. Just do not take her. Take the class in person instead!

This is by far the worst professor I have ever taken. Took her over the summer and spent the whole summer frustrated. She made typos on her quizzes that caused no points to be assigned for questions. When I asked her about it, she was rude and said no one else complained. Will not answer her emails. Does not answer questions on D2L. Run!!!!
Disrespectful to anyone that doesn't have the same thoughts she does. Rude and opinionated when nobody even asked her opinion. Worse class that I've ever taken.
Very unfriendly and unhelpful prof. She did not want to help her students learn the material. Her political views are her main concern. Avoid.....

Took her during the four-week summer session. Very understanding and let's you re-do some assignments. It was a lot of work in 4 weeks but she made it work. You should probably have some backbone cause she has a strong personality and will definitley give you her opinion.

I cannot understand why everyone complains about her. I think it is because those who do are not willing to be open to the profession they are going into. This is a class on how to teach Social Studies NOT how to learn Social Studies. She will challenge you and support you through this class-you have to give her the chance.
Dr. McKenzie is a great professor. Very knowledgeable. Some of us are too needy. Grow up!

She's really hard but I love Ethel!! She's hilarious and awesome but extremely tough. Just pay attention and take notes of her directions but they won't always go along with the syllabus. The best way to get on her good side is go visit her in her office, email her, etc. Just show interest and don't be rude to her! YIKES!

She gets angry when you ask questions and says you weren't listening, even if you were and were just confused. She grades hard but lets you redo some things. Long story short, she's not a good teacher. Don't take her.

Horrible! I did not learn a thing in this class. Her instructions are never clear, and does not tolerate many questions. No tests, just projects. But the projects are pointless. She will let you redo though. Avoid at all costs!
What a shame to have an education teacher who can't teach. Ethel is awful. Avoid at all costs and hopefully the school will deal with this situation. DO NOT take her or you'll be sorry!!!!!!
She is nice professor, but she is not very clear. If you are not a good writer, you probably will struggle....

The worst professor the Education Department has ever employed. You can write what she says verbatum and it is still wrong. She has no patience and has the nerve to get upset when questions are asked. I learned absolutely nothing in this class and was supposed to learn how to assess children and that was never addressed. Waste of a summer!
Good Luck with this one...

She is a pretty nice lady, but not clear with instructions at all! Very confusing. You can follow what directions she does give perfectly, and she will say you did it wrong. She is not mean at all, just not clear with what she wants out of you. The class isn't too hard. Lots of group work in class and one major paper is all! Fun class!
